item.title: Palabra del día en inglés: ‘corpulent’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en cinco artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: corpulent
item.description: This word has appeared in five articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Minnesota Governor Condemns ICE Shooting
item.description: Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota slammed the fatal shooting of a woman by an immigration agent. President Trump said that the agents had acted in self-defense.
item.dc:creator: Jiawei Wang

media:content.media:description: Gov. Tim Walz at the State Capitol in St. Paul, Minn., on Monday.

item.title: How Machado Lost Her Chance to Lead Venezuela
item.description: The opposition leader’s uncompromising style explains her political rise. But will that brand of politics work as well when it comes to running a country?
item.dc:creator: Francisco Rodríguez

item.title: On a Chinese Island, a Sunny Sanctuary for Russian Tourists
item.description: On a Chinese Island, a Sunny Sanctuary for Russian Tourists

media:content.media:credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Tourists from Russia and Kazakhstan cross a glass bridge over a rainforest near Sanya.

item.title: A Majority of Venezuelans Struggle to Pay for Food, Poll Shows
item.description: A new Gallup survey found that more than half of Venezuelans reported struggling to afford food last year, with economic hardship reaching even the wealthy.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ionova

media:content.media:description: At a street market in Caracas, the capital of Venezuela, in October.

item.title: Quote of the Day: One Year Later, Homes, Fury and Debt Rise From Ashes in L.A.
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 8, 2026.

item.title: Why Russian Tourists Are Flocking to Southern China’s Beaches
item.description: Russians find a refuge on the beaches of Sanya from sanctions and “sideways looks,” toasting the New Year beside a Chinese nuclear submarine base.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Higgins and Gilles Sabrié

item.title: When It Comes to Russia, Trump Navigates Conflicting Goals
item.description: President Trump’s efforts to court President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia are rife with contradictions about stability and displays of American power.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: President Trump meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin in Alaska last August. Mr. Trump’s focus on strength has magnified tensions with Russia in regions like Latin America, where Mr. Putin has sought to extend his influence

item.description: A New Year’s Eve countdown in Sanya, a resort city on China’s Hainan Island. Many vacationers here are from Russia, drawn by warm weather and Beijing’s visa-free travel policy.

item.title: Hoisting Russian Flags, ‘Shadow Fleet’ Edges Into the Light
item.description: The Marinera, which was seized by the U.S., isn’t the only ship from the “shadow fleet” of oil tankers to switch lately to a Russian identity, seeking protection.
item.dc:creator: Paul Sonne and Michael Schwirtz
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Vesa Moilanen/Lehtikuva, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The Eagle S, an oil tanker, last January after Finnish commandos commandeered it over suspicions that it had deliberately cut vital undersea cables. The authorities said the ship appeared to belong to Russia’s shadow fleet.

item.title: Corrections: Jan. 8, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Thursday, Jan. 8, 2026.

item.title: Glenn Hall, Pathbreaking All-Star Hockey Goalie, Dies at 94
item.description: Known as “Mr. Goalie,” he created the so-called butterfly style and played in a record 502 consecutive games, without wearing a mask. He received 300 stitches.
item.dc:creator: Richard Goldstein

media:content.media:description: Goalie Glenn Hall of the Chicago Blackhawks in 1959.

item.title: Steny Hoyer, Longest-Serving House Democrat, to Retire From Congress
item.description: The Maryland congressman, who served as one of his party’s top leaders, plans to depart after nearly half a century in Congress, as his party looks toward generational change.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Steny Hoyer in October.

item.title: See How Kennedy’s Inverted Food Pyramid Stacks Up
item.description: The new pyramid is the picture of the Make America Healthy Again movement, prioritizing whole foods, proteins and fats.
item.dc:creator: Alice Callahan

item.title: Mamdani Hosts Influencer Summit, Sidestepping Traditional Media
item.description: A friendly summit at New York’s City Hall with digital content creators and social media stars symbolized the new mayor’s attitude toward the changing news media.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Grynbaum

item.title: What We Know About the Fatal ICE Shooting in Minneapolis
item.description: Officials in Minnesota have disputed federal accounts of the shooting that killed a 37-year-old woman on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra E. Petri and Hannah Ziegler

media:content.media:description: A vigil last night in Minneapolis on the street where Renee Nicole Good was killed after an encounter with federal officers on Wednesday.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Jan. 8, 2026
item.description: Mallory Montgomery makes her New York Times Crossword debut, in collaboration with Zhou Zhang.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

media:content.media:description: This black redstart chick is here to encourage you as you dig into this puzzle.

item.title: Trump Withdraws the U.S. From More International Organizations
item.description: The executive order the president signed Wednesday follows a broader vision of American foreign policy that shuns coalition building and the consensus of nations.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: President Trump speaking at the United Nations General Assembly last year. The U.N. did not immediately comment on the United States’ severing relationships with some of its organizations.

item.title: Spencer Pratt, Reality TV Star, Runs for Mayor of Los Angeles
item.description: The star of “The Hills,” whose house burned in the Palisades fire, has used his social media profile to hammer Mayor Karen Bass and other California Democrats over the past year.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler

media:content.media:description: Spencer Pratt, whose home in Pacific Palisades was burned in last January's wildfire, announced his candidacy for mayor of Los Angeles on Wednesday.

item.title: EE. UU. consolida su control del petróleo venezolano al incautar un buque con bandera de Rusia
item.description: El buque fue uno de los dos puestos bajo custodia estadounidense mientras el gobierno de Trump afirmaba estar ejecutando un “acuerdo para llevarse todo el petróleo”.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Nehamas, Eric Schmitt, Julian E. Barnes and Michael Levenson
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: El petrolero Marinera, antes conocido como Bella 1, en alta mar en el estrecho de Singapur el año pasado.

item.title: Minnesota’s Dispute With Trump Administration Boils Over After ICE Shooting
item.description: The contradicting accounts of the ICE shooting in Minneapolis from the federal government and officials in Minnesota were the latest episode in a dispute that has been building for weeks.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:description: Gov. Tim Walz at the State Capitol in St. Paul, Minn., on Monday.

item.title: Trump y Petro hablan por teléfono en medio de las tensiones
item.description: El presidente estadounidense indicó que su equipo estaba organizando una visita del mandatario colombiano a la Casa Blanca.
item.dc:creator: Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump de regreso a la Casa Blanca el domingo. Trump dijo que esperaba reunirse pronto con el presidente de Colombia en la Casa Blanca.

item.title: What Is the UNFCCC and Why Is the U.S. Pulling Out?
item.description: The Trump administration said Wednesday that the United States was withdrawing from 66 international agreements, including a major climate change treaty.
item.dc:creator: Somini Sengupta
item.category: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

media:content.media:description: The United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, or UNFCCC, is the treaty that sets a legal framework for international negotiations to address climate change.

item.title: Protests Spread in Iran, and Crackdowns Escalate
item.description: Bazaars were shuttered and demonstrators met with violence from security forces amid rising anger about the country’s dire economic situation.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:description: An image taken from social media shows Iranian security forces using tear gas to disperse protesters at the Tehran bazaar on Tuesday.

item.title: Renee Good, Victim in Minneapolis ICE Shooting, Remembered for Her Kindness
item.description: Renee Good, 37, a resident of Minneapolis, was mourned on Wednesday as a cherished member of the community.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mourners placing flowers at a makeshift memorial near the site in Minneapolis where Renee Nicole Good, 37, was shot and killed in her vehicle.

item.title: Trump and Colombian President Speak by Phone Amid Escalating Tensions
item.description: The American president said a White House visit with Gustavo Petro was being arranged by the secretary of state.
item.dc:creator: Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump returning to the White House on Sunday. Mr. Trump said he was looking forward to a meeting with Colombia’s president at the White House soon.

item.title: Politicians Share Different Views of ICE Shooting Videos
item.description: In a polarized country, high-ranking officials were offering definitive, and starkly contrasting, accounts long before the facts could be established.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Streeter

media:content.media:description: A federal officer shot and killed a 37-year-old woman in Minneapolis during an immigration enforcement operation Wednesday,

item.title: Brain Health Challenge: Try a Brain Teaser
item.description: Trying new things can help boost cognitive reserve. Today, we’ll challenge you with a game.
item.dc:creator: Dana G. Smith

item.title: Federal Agent Fatally Shoots Woman in Minneapolis
item.description: Federal officials claimed that the 37-year-old woman was trying to kill agents with a car in Minneapolis, while city and state officials disputed their account.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal and Devon Lum

item.title: El ‘tracksuit’ de Maduro estaba destinado a ser un meme
item.description: Cuando el presidente Trump compartió una foto no verificada de Nicolás Maduro bajo custodia de EE. UU., un rincón de internet siguió un manual conocido para las imágenes noticiosas: hablar de la ropa.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Trump Proposes Huge Increase in Military Spending
item.description: The president’s proposal for a $600 billion increase comes as his administration pushes for American imperialism.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:credit: Jason Andrew for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Military vehicles moving across the Arlington Memorial Bridge during a military parade in Washington in June.

item.title: University to Pay $500,000 to Professor It Fired Over Charlie Kirk Post
item.description: Austin Peay State University in Tennessee also reinstated Darren Michael, a tenured acting professor whose post about Mr. Kirk’s killing inflamed conservatives.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

media:content.media:description: Austin Peay, based in Clarksville, Tenn., backtracked on firing the professor less than two weeks later, placing him on a paid suspension.

item.title: Arthur Cohn, Film Producer With an Oscar-Winning Touch, Dies at 98
item.description: Six of his movies received Academy Awards, including the Italian drama “The Garden of the Finzi-Continis” and the trade-union strike documentary “American Dream.”
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter

media:content.media:description: Arthur Cohn in his office in Basel, Switzerland, in 2000. “I search for projects that are out of the ordinary, enriching and apt to be remembered for a long time,” he said.

item.title: Caso Reiner: El abogado defensor de Nick Reiner se retira
item.description: Nick Reiner, a quien se acusa de asesinar a sus padres, estará representado ahora por una abogada de oficio. Su comparecencia está prevista para el próximo mes.
item.dc:creator: Tim Arango and Matt Stevens

media:content.media:description: Nick Reiner fue acusado de dos cargos de asesinato en primer grado. Si es declarado culpable, podría enfrentarse a cadena perpetua sin libertad condicional o a la pena de muerte.

item.title: Stephen Miller ofrece una visión del mundo donde reina la fuerza
item.description: El jefe adjunto de personal y asesor de seguridad nacional del presidente Trump ahora dirige su mirada de extrema derecha hacia el extranjero.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Miller, quien goza de la plena confianza del presidente, tiene una plantilla de más de 40 personas y varias tareas importantes, como proteger el territorio nacional y asegurar los territorios más lejanos.

item.title: The ICE Shooting Came During an Operation Focused on Somali Immigrants
item.description: Federal immigration officials have stepped up enforcement activity in Minnesota amid a fraud scandal there that includes many people of Somali origin.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra

media:content.media:description: Federal officers surround Gregory Bovino, center, a senior Border Patrol official, at the site in Minneapolis where a federal immigration officer fatally shot a woman on Wednesday.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Either a Good Omen or a Nightmare’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: Trump Officials Flip Food Pyramid With New Dietary Guidelines
item.description: The Trump administration released new dietary guidelines on Wednesday that flipped the food pyramid on its head, putting steak, cheese and whole milk near the top. These guidelines shape the foods served in schools, hospitals, prisons, military bases and through federal assistance programs, and rarely change in substance when they are updated every five years.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times

item.title: How Venezuela Is Already Rattling Republican Thomas Massie’s Primary Race
item.description: Most Republicans are on board with Trump’s aggression. Not Thomas Massie.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times; Jeff Faughender/Courier Journal, via Imagn
media:content.media:description: Representative Thomas Massie of Kentucky, left, is facing a Trump-backed challenge from Ed Gallrein, right.

item.title: Authorities Often Justify Motorist Shootings by Saying the Vehicle Was a Weapon
item.description: Federal officials said the Minneapolis driver who was shot by an immigration agent was using her vehicle as a weapon, a claim that local officials have disputed.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Dewan

media:content.media:description: A driver was fatally shot by a federal agent in Minneapolis on Wednesday.

item.title: Beyond Minnesota, Social Media Fuels False Rumors of Fraud Among Somalis
item.description: The Ohio governor is once again trying to counter misinformation about immigrants, more than a year after baseless claims that Haitians in Springfield were eating pets.
item.dc:creator: Billy Witz

media:content.media:credit: Doral Chenoweth/Columbus Dispatch/USA Today Network, via Imagn Images
media:content.media:description: “We need to look at this as not a Somali problem, we need to look at this as a fraud problem,” Gov. Mike DeWine of Ohio said during a news conference on Monday.

item.title: Venezuelans in U.S. Share Hopes for Returning Home
item.description: For some Venezuelans living in the U.S., the American government’s seizure and removal of Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, has given them the hope of one day returning home.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna and Daniel Fetherston

item.title: ¿Comprar o tomar Groenlandia? Un viejo pacto ya da carta libre a Trump
item.description: Algunos analistas afirman que un acuerdo de la Guerra Fría permite al presidente aumentar la presencia militar estadounidense en la isla casi a voluntad.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Gettleman, Amelia Nierenberg and Maya Tekeli
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Ivor Prickett para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Los restos de una base aérea estadounidense en Groenlandia llamada Bluie East Two, construida durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial.

item.title: The U.S. Seizes Two Oil Tankers With Ties to Venezuela
item.description: On Wednesday, the United States seized two oil tankers, including a Russian-flagged ship. Secretary of State Marco Rubio also outlined a plan for Venezuela’s near future.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

item.title: Trump Pulls Out of Global Climate Treaty
item.description: The action could make it more difficult for a future administration to rejoin the Paris climate accord, the agreement among most nations to fight climate change.
item.dc:creator: Somini Sengupta and Lisa Friedman

media:content.media:description: President Trump addressing the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly in New York last year.

item.title: For Theater in January, the Under the Radar Festival Reigns Supreme
item.description: Several festivals run across New York this month, but none are as big and eclectic as Under the Radar, founded in 2005. Here are our picks for what to see.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Vincentelli

item.title: What Are ‘Ghost Fleet’ Ships?
item.description: Also known as “dark fleet” or “shadow fleet” ships, the vessels use murky tactics to transport oil in violation of sanctions.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil

media:content.media:description: An image from video footage released by the U.S. military purporting to show the seizure of the oil tanker M Sophia in the Caribbean Sea on Wednesday.

item.title: Man Accused of Stealing Billions in Crypto Scam Is Captured Abroad
item.description: Chen Zhi faces an indictment in federal court in Brooklyn on charges of swindling millions of dollars from Americans as part of a global cryptocurrency scam.
item.dc:creator: Santul Nerkar

media:content.media:credit: Tang Chhin Sothy/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Chen Zhi was arrested in Cambodia and faces charges of running forced labor camps where trafficked workers carried out cryptocurrency fraud schemes.

item.title: The U.S. Seized Two Oil Tankers
item.description: Also, an ICE agent fatally shot a woman in Minneapolis. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:description: The tanker formerly known as the Bella 1, which was seized today.
